mcq.statement: What does the idiom 'Don't judge a book by its cover' imply?

options.a: Do not read books with unattractive covers
options.b: Do not form an opinion based solely on appearance
options.c: Always cover your books to protect them
options.d: Judge the content by the quality of the cover

mcq.one_liner: The idiom 'Don't judge a book by its cover' suggests that one should not form an opinion on something based on its outward appearance alone.
